data.name: Incineroar

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Darkest Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it's not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer's orders with complete nonchalance.

data.name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Invisible Wall
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (including your own) does 30 or more damage to Mr. Mime (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Mr. Mime is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If interrupted while miming, it will slap around the enemy with its broad hands.

data.name: Bisharp

attacks.name: Wicked Jab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Castform, Sunny Castform, or Snow-cloud Castform and switch it with Rain Castform. (Any cards attached to Rain Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Rain Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Holon Splash
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Holon Energy card attached to Rain Castform.

data.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Seething Tentacles
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Normally, it has 80 poisonous tentacles. The longer one has been alive, the fewer tentacles it will have.

data.name: Feraligatr

abilities.name: Downpour
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Water Energy card from your hand.

attacks.name: Riptide
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy card in your discard pile. Then, shuffle those cards into your deck.

data.flavorText: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done by your opponent's Pokémon to each of your Benched Pokémon that has δ on its card.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Cloyster.

data.name: Palkia-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spatial Control
attacks.text: Move any number of Energy from your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pressure
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zero Vanish-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle all Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon into their deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Carry In
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon Tool Card, a Supporter card, and a basic Energy card, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.

data.name: Milotic

attacks.name: Clear Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for any 3 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Its lovely scales are described as rainbow colored. They change color depending on the viewing angle.

data.name: Sandslash

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: If it digs at an incredible pace, it may snap off its spike and claws. They grow back in a day.

data.name: Light Piloswine

abilities.name: Fluffy Wool
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if Light Piloswine is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by your opponent's attack (even if it's Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, the attacking Pokémon is now Asleep. This power stops working if Light Piloswine is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when your opponent attacks.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: If there is a Stadium card in play, you may discard it.

data.flavorText: Its legs are short, but its hooves are wide and flat, allowing it to easily walk over snow.

data.name: Darumaka

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

attacks.name: Muddy Bomb
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon and 10 damage to each of your opponent's other Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Raging Sea
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Aerial Maneuvers
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage, and, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Koga's Pidgeotto. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.

data.name: Solgaleo-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ultra Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sunsteel Strike
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Burst-GX
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 5 Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Bergmite

attacks.name: Stomp Off
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.

data.name: Machamp

attacks.name: Macho Revenge
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Fighting Pokémon in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Dynamite Punch
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

data.name: Jynx

attacks.name: Icy Kiss
attacks.text: If Jynx was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lovely Kiss
attacks.text: Move 2 damage counters from Jynx to the Defending Pokémon. If Smoochum is anywhere under Jynx, move 4 damage counters instead.

data.flavorText: It cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.

data.name: Ducklett
data.flavorText: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

attacks.name: Destructive Roar
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gigacrush
attacks.text: Each player discards the top 3 cards from his or her deck.

data.name: Simisear

attacks.name: Flare Recharge
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

data.name: Bounsweet
data.flavorText: Because of its sweet, delicious aroma, bird Pokémon are always after it, but it's not intelligent enough to care.

data.name: Team Magma's Poochyena

attacks.name: Infiltrate
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

data.flavorText: Poochyena's nose can identify any scent. It's very useful for reconnaissance.

data.name: Dark Dugtrio

abilities.name: Sinkhole
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's Active Pokémon retreats, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this power does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power stops working while Dark Dugtrio is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Knock Down
attacks.text: Your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if heads, this attack does 20 damage.

data.flavorText: Digs large sinkholes in the ground and tries to trap its enemies in them.

data.name: Panpour
data.flavorText: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

data.name: Gastrodon

attacks.name: Sticky Shot
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless more, and its Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.

data.name: Victini V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spreading Flames
attacks.text: Attach up to 3 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

data.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

data.name: Dhelmise

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Powerful Spin
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokémon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.

data.name: Heatmor

attacks.name: Reinforced Flame
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.

data.name: Metal Energy
rules:
Damage done to the Pokémon Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If the Pokémon Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal, whenever it damages a Pokémon, reduce that damage by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Kyurem-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giga Frost
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Finishing Blow
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: It can live in or out of water. When out of water, it constantly sweats to keep its body slimy.

data.name: Meganium

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Meganium.

data.flavorText: Meganium's breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.

data.name: Psyduck
data.flavorText: It has mystical powers but doesn't recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.

data.name: Darmanitan

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: When weakened in battle, it transforms into a stone statue, then it sharpens its mind and fights on mentally.

data.name: Reshiram

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 or more for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

data.name: Heatmor

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: There's a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.

data.name: Wooper
data.flavorText: When the temperature cools in the evening, they emerge from water to seek food along the shore.

attacks.name: Tail Shake
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Golduck

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Swim
attacks.text: If any of your opponent's Pokémon have any Water Energy attached to them, you may do 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon instead of their Active Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Even fast-swimming fish Pokémon can be disabled by Golduck. It brings them to a standstill and seizes them.

data.name: Charizard VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Wildfire
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Pansear

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600º F.

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is on your Bench, you pay ColorlessColorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Baby Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Zarude V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Jungle Rising
attacks.text: You may attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, heal all damage from that Pokémon.

data.name: Floatzel

attacks.name: Screw Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Floatzel but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

data.flavorText: It floats using its well-developed floatation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Torchic.

data.name: Larvesta

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.

data.name: Arbok

abilities.name: Last Pattern
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, discard 2 random cards from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Rocket Tail
attacks.text: If Jessie & James is in your discard pile, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: The latest research has determined that there are over 20 possible arrangements of the patterns on its stomach.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Pull Away
attacks.text: If your opponent has 5 or more cards in his or her hand, your opponent discards a number of cards until your opponent has 4 cards left in his or her hand.

data.name: Swinub
data.flavorText: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

attacks.name: High Voltage
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Thunder Flare
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Lt. Surge's Jolteon, then flip a coin. If tails, Lt. Surge's Jolteon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Avalugg

attacks.name: Frost Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Shatter
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

data.flavorText: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.

data.name: Skarmory

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Skarmory.

data.flavorText: After nesting in bramble bushes, the wings of its chicks grow hard from scratches by thorns.

data.name: Magby
rules: If your Active Pokémon is a Baby Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Energy Catch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Palkia

attacks.name: Spacial Rend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If there is any Stadium card in play, discard it.

attacks.name: Transback
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard all Energy attached to Palkia and put the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

data.name: Dark Golbat

abilities.name: Sneak Attack
abilities.text: When you play Dark Golbat from your hand, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you do, Dark Golbat does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Flitter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

data.flavorText: Sneaks up silently on its prey and attacks it from behind, sometimes killing it with one bite.

attacks.name: Double Pinchers
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Dark Poison
attacks.text: Discard a basic Energy card attached to Team Aqua's Corphish or this attack does nothing. The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Empoleon

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Jet Smash
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 70 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Empoleon can't use Jet Smash during your next turn.

data.flavorText: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.

data.name: Froakie

abilities.name: Frubbles
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

data.name: Malamar

abilities.name: Psychic Recharge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It lures prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.text: Any damage done to Dewgong by attacks from Fire Pokémon and Water Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Ice Shard
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack's base damage is 80 instead of 30.

data.name: Articuno

attacks.name: Diamond Dust
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This legendary Pokémon is said to freeze the water in the air during winter, causing snow.

data.name: Turtonator

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.

data.name: Simipour

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Stadium Wave
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Golem GL.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Golem E4 does 60 damage to itself.

data.name: Steenee

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It's protected by its hard sepals, so it plays with bird Pokémon without worry. They peck it relentlessly, but it doesn't care.

data.name: Darumaka

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.

data.name: Plusle

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Plusle does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.

abilities.name: Fragrance Trap
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Erika's Victreebel is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Slugma

attacks.name: Magma Ring
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

data.name: Tropius

attacks.name: Fresh-Picked Fruit
attacks.text: Remove 6 damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The bunch of fruit around its neck ripens twice a year and is delicious. It's a highly favored tropical snack.

abilities.name: Metallic Lift
abilities.text: If Skarmory has any Metal Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Skarmory is 0.

attacks.name: Spearhead
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Heavy Metal
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Metal Energy attached to Skarmory. This attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Articuno-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Frost Prison
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Invisible Hand
attacks.text: If any of your opponent's Active Pokémon are Evolved Pokémon, search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Repulsion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent returns the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to his or her hand. (If your opponent doesn't have any Benched Pokémon or other Active Pokémon, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Psychic Erase
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Hitmontop is an Evolved Pokémon, is your Active Pokémon, and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Hitmontop is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Upward Kick
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has at least 2 damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

data.name: Dusknoir

abilities.name: Spirit Pulse
abilities.text: As long as Dusknoir is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it between turns.

attacks.name: Darkness Mist
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

data.name: Armaldo

abilities.name: Fossil Armor
abilities.text: If Armaldo would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Armaldo if that damage is 60 or less.

attacks.name: Crush Claw
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It went ashore after evolving. Its entire body is clad in a sturdy armor.

data.name: Emolga

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Acrobatics
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membranes and released while it is gliding.

data.name: Heatmor

attacks.name: Odor Sleuth
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant's steel bodies and consume their insides.

abilities.name: Dark Moon
abilities.text: As long as Umbreon is your Active Pokémon and has a Darkness Energy attached to it, once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at your opponent's hand. Choose from it a number of cards up to the number of Darkness Energy attached to Umbreon and shuffle them into your opponent's deck. Your opponent then draws the same number of cards from his or her deck. This power can't be used if Umbreon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Cleffa
rules: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

attacks.name: Eeeeeeek

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Your opponent now puts 3 damage counters on it instead of 1 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It can take down any opponent with its powerful poison stingers. It sometimes attacks in swarms.

abilities.name: Soothing Aroma
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any. This power can't be used if Meganium is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Basculin

attacks.name: Bared Fangs
attacks.text: If, before this Pokémon does damage, the Defending Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's school.

attacks.name: Influence
attacks.text: Search your deck for Omanyte, Kabuto, Aerodactyl, Lileep, or Anorith and put up to 2 of them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stretch Claws
attacks.text: If Anorith has any React Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Lightning Burn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This legendary Pokémon is said to be present wherever there is a lightning storm.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Take up to 2 Lightning Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz.

attacks.name: Electric Current
attacks.text: Take 1 Lightning Energy card attached to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you have no Benched Pokémon, discard that Energy card.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Silver Wind
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Gengar

attacks.name: Life Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counter on the Defending Pokémon until it is 10 HP away from being Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Shadow Dance
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. Then, switch Gengar with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It hides in shadows. It is said that if Gengar is hiding, it cools that area by nearly 10 degrees F.

data.name: Tympole
data.flavorText: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

data.name: Reshiram-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glinting Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Brave Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Vespiquen

abilities.name: Defense Sign
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Grass Pokémon by attacks.

attacks.name: Mach Wind
attacks.text: During your next turn, Vespiquen's Retreat Cost is 0.

data.flavorText: It raises grubs in the holes in its body. It secretes pheromones to control Combee.

data.name: Minun

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Tag Team Boost
attacks.text: If Plusle is on your Bench, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.

data.name: Incineroar

attacks.name: Profane Punch
attacks.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: Flare Blitz
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it's not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer's orders with complete nonchalance.

data.name: Alolan Sandslash

abilities.name: Slush Rush
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Fleeing a volcanic eruption, it settled on a snowy mountain. As it races through the snowfields, it sends up a spray of snow.

data.name: Tyranitar

attacks.name: Tail Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It has an insolent nature that makes it not care about others.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Burst
attacks.text: If Sidney's Stadium is in play, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Heracross E4's Megahorn attack's base damage is 100.

attacks.name: Megahorn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Pachirisu

attacks.name: Trick Sticker
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon's Weakness is now Lightning until the end of your next turn. (The amount of Weakness doesn't change.)

attacks.name: Pachi
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

data.name: Magcargo

abilities.name: Smooth Over
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a card, shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.

data.flavorText: Its body is as hot as lava and is always billowing. Flames will occasionally burst from its shell.

data.name: Spheal

attacks.name: Unstoppable Roll
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It rolls across ice floes to reach shore because its body is poorly shaped for swimming.

data.name: Flareon

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Flareon in order to use this attack.

data.flavorText: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.

attacks.name: Energy Retrieval
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon for each Energy card attached in this way.

attacks.name: Damage Shift
attacks.text: Move 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any on it to the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)

attacks.name: Water Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Birthday Surprise
attacks.text: If it's not your birthday, this attack does 30 damage. If it is your birthday, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

data.name: Golduck BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Golduck BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

abilities.name: Hyper Transfer
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

data.name: Delphox-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Wonder Flare
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. This attack does 40 more damage for each Energy card in your opponent's hand.

data.name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Irongrip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing its victim around and toss it hard.

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If your opponent has fewer than 3 Benched Pokémon, do that damage to each of them.

data.flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.

attacks.name: Hoard
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon that already have a Pokémon Tool attached to them). Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Salazzle

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Only female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden with pheromones to captivate male Salandit.

data.name: Sealeo
data.flavorText: It habitually spins things on its nose. By doing so, it learns textures and odors.

data.name: Carvanha
data.flavorText: Each school has its own territory. Any intruders are mercilessly attacked with fangs bared.

data.name: Blastoise-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Splash Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Corsola

attacks.name: Bubble Shoot
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Pursued by Mareanie for the branches on its head, this Pokémon will sometimes snap its own branches off as a diversion while it escapes.

data.name: Torchic

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Farfetch'd stays in play (even putting Farfetch'd on the Bench won't let you use it again).

data.flavorText: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. This sprig is used much like a metal sword.

data.name: Oricorio

attacks.name: Supernatural Dance
attacks.text: For each Pokémon in your opponent's discard pile, put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Revelation Dance
attacks.text: If there is no Stadium card in play, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: This Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. Its elegant, attractive dance will send the minds and hearts of its enemies to another world.

data.name: Palpitoad

attacks.name: Suspicious Soundwave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

attacks.name: Raging Tremble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on Whiscash to each Defending Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on Whiscash to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dwindling Wave
attacks.text: Does 70 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Whiscash.

data.name: Sneasel

attacks.name: Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard all Trainer cards attached to your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its paws conceal sharp claws. If attacked, it suddenly extends the claws and startles its enemy.

attacks.name: Super Psywave
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Count the number of Energy cards attached to that Pokémon. Put that many damage counters on the Pokémon.

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Jynx is an Evolved Pokémon, you pay Colorless less to retreat your Fire and Psychic Pokémon.

data.name: Zamazenta V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dauntless Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon VMAX.

attacks.name: Assault Tackle
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ghost Hand
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cursed Wrath
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon SP in your discard pile.

abilities.name: Wild Guard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Rapidash by your opponent's Pokémon SP.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Oshawott
data.flavorText: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

data.name: Glaceon

attacks.name: Ice Shot
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: As a protective technique, it can completely freeze its fur to make its hairs stand like needles.

data.name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quintuple Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: With its excellent sense of smell, it's even able to find mushrooms that are buried under frozen ground.

data.name: Weezing

abilities.name: Surrender Now
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is discarded with the effect of Jessie & James, you may have your opponent discard a card from their hand. (They discard that card after the effect of Jessie & James.)

data.flavorText: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

attacks.name: Metal Load
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Metal Energy card and attach it to Metang.

abilities.name: Dual Armor
abilities.text: As long as Medicham has any Psychic Energy cards attached to it, Medicham is both Psychic and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Snap Tail
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Bastiodon

abilities.name: Protective Wall
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by your opponent's attacks.

attacks.name: Anger Revenge
attacks.text: If Bastiodon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.

data.name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Raging Flames
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

data.flavorText: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.

data.name: Beautifly

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Butterfly Edge
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its long, narrow mouth to drain the prey's fluids.

data.name: Sudowoodo

abilities.name: Roadblock
abilities.text: Your opponent can't have more than 4 Benched Pokémon. If they have 5 or more Benched Pokémon, they discard Benched Pokémon until they have 4 Pokémon on the Bench. If more than one effect changes the number of Benched Pokémon allowed, use the smaller number.

data.flavorText: To avoid attack, it mimics a tree. It will run off if splashed with water, which it hates.

data.name: Zygarde

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fighting Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.

attacks.name: Zzzap
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each Pokémon with a Poké-Body or Poké-Power (yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance.)

attacks.name: Lightning Storm
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, put 2 damage counters on Raichu.

data.name: Darumaka
data.flavorText: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.

data.name: Combusken

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: During a battle, the hot flame in its body increases. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.

data.name: Koffing

attacks.name: Division
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Koffing and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.

attacks.name: Poison Scent
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Asleep.

attacks.name: Addictive Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Supporter cards during his or her next turn.

data.name: Team Aqua's Mightyena

attacks.name: Teampact
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Team Aqua Pokémon you have in play. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Thanks to Mightyena's outstanding leadership, it's very good at combination attacks that can leave a foe helpless.

data.name: Sunflora

abilities.name: Sunshine Grace
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Sunflora is affected by a Special Condition.

data.flavorText: It converts sunlight into energy. In the darkness after sunset, it closes its petals and becomes still.

data.name: Politoed

abilities.name: King's Song
abilities.text: Ignore all Colorless Energy in the attack cost of each of your Poliwag, Poliwhirl, and Poliwrath's attacks.

data.flavorText: Whenever three or more of these get together, they sing in a loud voice that sounds like bellowing.

data.name: Vanillite
data.flavorText: The temperature of their breath is -58° F. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.

data.name: Dhelmise

attacks.name: Sea Creeper Net
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It wraps its prey in green seaweed and sucks away their vitality. It only likes to go after big prey like Wailord.

data.name: Victini

abilities.name: Victory Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

data.name: Mismagius

attacks.name: Sleeping Spell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Trainer, Supporter, and Stadium cards in your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.

data.name: Eelektrik

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.

data.name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Magic Dust
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now either Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned (your choice).

attacks.name: Hyper Reverse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon. After doing damage, remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to the amount of damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.

data.name: Palpitoad

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

data.flavorText: It lives in water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to capture prey.

data.name: Latios

attacks.name: Energy Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to Latios. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to Latios.

data.flavorText: A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.

data.name: Heracross

attacks.name: Pitch
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Horn Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It gathers in forests to search for tree sap, its favorite food. It's strong enough to hurl foes.

abilities.name: Sand Cover
abilities.text: As long as Hippowdon is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon LV.X between turns.

attacks.name: Save Sand
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Hippowdon. Before doing damage, you may search your discard pile for a Fighting Energy card and attach it to Hippowdon.

attacks.name: Groundquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon that isn't an Evolved Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon).

data.name: Squirtle

abilities.name: Shell Shield
abilities.text: As along as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Allergy Flower
abilities.text: Each player can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Dazzling Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

data.name: Manectric

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

data.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Grand Flame
attacks.text: Attach 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Legends tell of its fighting alongside a general and conquering a whole country.

data.name: Applin

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

data.flavorText: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it's just an apple and nothing more.

data.name: Donphan

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Donphan.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokémon, then, if you have any Benched Pokémon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.
